alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of , the City of Norfolk, the central City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth and the City of Virginia Beach through 515 PM EDT... At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Princess Anne to Bowers Hill. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Regent University and Princess Anne around 455 PM EDT. Kempsville around 500 PM EDT. Churchland around 505 PM EDT. Downtown Portsmouth around 510 PM EDT. Virginia Beach, Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Norfolk State University, Ocean View, Portsmouth, Ghent, Norfolk NAS and Norview around 515 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Norfolk, Rudee Heights, Portlock, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Herberts Corner, Oceana NAS, Macons Corner, Pungo and Greenbrier. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
